page.title: 02A Local Farm
page.content: Mr.Ashworth farms both{Lodge and Vale {Farms,}in all about 600 acres, some owned and some rented from the {Sennowe Park Estate}at Guist (See page 3). He has 300 dairy cows and his own milking parlour. All cattle are bred on the farm.Crops include wheat, barley, oats, maize, peas,kale and lucerne. Grass is grown for conversion to silage, and beans are also grown for cattle feed. Some wheat and barley is retained for seed. The rest is sold - some of the barley to{Ryburgh {Maltings}- other crops as far afield as France and Japan. Grain merchants from Scotland, London and Burton on Trent visit the farm to agree prices.
